Abstract: This review explores recent advancements in sustainable polymers derived from biological matter, addressing the growing demand for eco-friendly materials. We examine the development of biopolymers and biocomposites, focusing on their applications in various industries, including construction and packaging. The utilization of renewable resources in polymer synthesis is discussed, highlighting the potential for reducing environmental impact and fossil fuel dependence. Particular attention is given to the incorporation of biological matter in cementitious materials, showcasing innovative approaches to enhance sustainability in the built environment. The review also evaluates the challenges and opportunities associated with scaling up production and improving the performance of bio-based polymers. By synthesizing current research, this work provides insights into the future of sustainable materials and their role in promoting a circular economy.
